9.15.22  2:15 am   uhhh, bill, i was looking around in google street view like you said you sometimes did to write, and i accidentally wrote half a song (whoops). the funny part about this is that i have never actually written a song before (or at least nothing longer than a handful of bars). i also don't have the skills or tools needed to MAKE the song (or any music for that matter). so i guess the logical thing to do would be to spend next few years working to gain the musical skills needed to make this song and many others real?

Â Â Â Â Â  sure, that would be fine. although there is no exact goal-post for when you are 'good enough to make a song'. you could practice your whole life and not really be good enough, or, you might be already good enough now. just go ahead and write down the song somehow (make a recording and try to sing it and/or describe everything you know about it) and file it away and then when you feel brave enough you can do it

9.14.22  11:35 pm   You've probably been asked plenty before. But, alas I ask anyway. What has inspired your sound/style of production/song writing if anything?

Â Â Â Â Â just trying to get by. i do it any way i can

     I've been writing music for a few years now and can't help but pretty much write the same thing a lot of times. Any advice on that?

Â Â Â Â Â to change this, you might have to temporarily venture into the realm of what you might consider 'not good'. this may seem scary, but, music is like an angel. it will find its way to goodness, and this time it will hopefully be different because you changed the approach angle
